comments:
Hi Guys,

I am using Eclipse 2.1 on Linux RedHat9 with Sun J2sdk1.4.1_02.

In a normal Open FIle operation Eclipse has displayed a messag indicating a SWT 
internal Error and the it exit.

Best Regards,

Andrea

Created an attachment (id=5000)
Thi is the Eclipse Error Log FIle

That's is bad, we might have a leaking in GTK.

org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2358)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2262)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:368)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.internal_new_GC(Control.java:1845)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC.<init>(GC.java:69)

Was you running eclipse for several days (non-stop) ?
Can you reproduce this problem ?

Hi Felipe,

I have moved to Eclipse 2.1.1 M20030528. I use Eclipse all days.

The problem heppens randomly. 

I don't know if I am able to reproduce the problem.

There are some days where eclipse crash 1 or 2 time a day and other times where
eclipse works perfectly.

Best Regards,

Andrea
Felipe is tracking GTK version/crash issues.
Andrea, do you still have this problem running on Eclipse 3.0 ?

Hello Felipe,

Sorry for my late but I was on holiday.

Actually I am using Eclipse 3.0 with j2sdk 1.4.2_05 on WinXP and Linux FC1 both.

I have not noted the problem since now. If it be occure in the future I'll
reopen the bug again.

Best Regards,

Andrea
